The provided context outlines the recruitment and selection policy of IIA. According to the policy, the HR department is responsible for assessing the relative importance of each skill and qualification for a position, preparing job descriptions, and advertising vacancies. 

The selection process involves a written exam with three parts: aptitude test, general knowledge, and basic intelligence test, followed by a technical skill test. Candidates who meet the benchmark for selection criteria are interviewed for the job. The test and interview are conducted by the executive head and department head to assess the selected candidates' job suitability.

According to the provided context, the Uniform / Dress Code Policy of IIA states that the organization may decide the uniform for all levels of its employees. Separate codes of dress should be provided for summer and winter seasons. The pattern, color, and code of uniform will be different for Executive staff compared to Non-Executive staff.

In normal conditions, employees are expected to wear Shirt Trouser with other accessories of prescribed color and design. However, female employees with serious health issues may be allowed to wear Saree and Blouse or Salwar Kurta for convenience, provided they are of the prescribed color and design.

IIA will provide dress to all its employees as follows:
- 2 Sets of Trouser + Shirt once a year
- Formal Shoes once a year
- One Blazer once in two years for Executives and One Jacket for Non-Executives

The management has the right to discontinue or hold the uniform policy only if a financial limitation arises.
